revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Ready
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Agreed: ι better than ε, ν (in this hand) better than το.

Submit - PN correction to name at end of l. 1. Iota is better than ed.'s epsilon, then final string could be read either ν or το, but ν looks better and leads to known name. It's possible that a tiny omicron marking abbrev. is lost at right.
Finalized - Ready.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Fine.

Submit - Z. 10: Θ̣[εωφώρο]υ → Θ̣[εοδώρο]υ (Eingabefehler). Z. 11: Ἀρσι(νοίτης) → Ἀρσι(νοίτου) (falsche Auflösung der Abkürzung). Z. 12 App.: l. χρείαν → l. χώραν (s. F. Preisigke, Wörterbuch II, 765), was zweifellos richtig ist; man kann daher wohl auf die Erwähnung des „χρείαν (?)“ von P.Lond. verzichten.
Finalized - Ready. In lin2 of the ed.pr. my eta is followed by a superscript tau. At some stage of entry into DDbDP this was presumably assumed to be an abbreviation for μητ(ρὸς).
Vote - AcceptText - Correction seems highly plausible; μητ(ρόϲ) not in ed.pr.
General - It also does not appear to have been picked up anywhere else, so should be encoded as a PN correction.
Vote - AcceptText - This certainly looks like a very good correction to me. There appears to be no image available.

Submit - changed l. 2 [.4] (μητ(ρὸς)) which is not logical to ([κεκοσ]μητ(ευκότος) depending on D. Hagedorn, “Zur Verwendung von υἱός und vor dem Vatersnamen in Urkunden römischer Zeit”, ZPE 80 (1990) 277-82. I have no idea where (μητ(ρὸς)) came from
rationalized languages in langUsage
changed editor names to URIs
changed type=inWord to break=no
Automatically updated revision description
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
Automated split from transcoder files
